input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Liking spicy food has a direct effect on occupation and salary. Skill has a direct effect on occupation and salary. Occupation has a direct effect on salary. Skill is unobserved. The overall probability of liking spicy food is 82%. The probability of not liking spicy food and high salary is 5%. The probability of liking spicy food and high salary is 41%. Is the chance of high salary smaller when observing liking spicy food?
